I would recommend "Hart's War" if you're looking for a war movie with an engaging plot. On the other hand, if you're interested in a romantic drama set during World War II, then I would recommend "Doctor Zhivago". This classic Russian novel has been adapted into several movies, including the 1970 Academy Award-winning adaptation directed by Sergei Bondarchuk.
"Doctor Zhivago" tells the story of a doctor who falls in love with a political activist' s wife. The doctor witnesses several dramatic events during World War II, and he ultimately becomes involved in the political turmoil that follows.
The movie was released in 2010, directed by Peter Medak and starring Ben Affleck as the doctor, Jennifer Garner as the political activist' s wife, Mako as a man on a horse, and Michael Peña as a man on a horse.
Overall, "Hart's War" is a well-made war movie with an engaging plot. On the other hand, if you're interested in a romantic drama set during World War II, then I would recommend "Doctor Zhivago".
